result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A Kemp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn A Kemp is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn A Kemp was found guilty of Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution from 14CM128 read in on this case.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Complete any alternatives to revocation now pending, restitution in the stipulation, psychological counseling/treatment and take psychotropic medications if needed. Complete anger management counseling if required by agent, maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with N.B. without agent's consent, may send mail to the house addressed to the children, maintain full-time work, school or treatment.  Pay restitution in stipulation. DNA sample need not be submitted. Jail credit to be determined by stipulation.

records.addlTxt: ADA Genda has no objection to JOC be amended to 5 yrs. probation per Wis. Stats. 973.09(2)(b)
Letter from DOC Admissions Registrar Kathryn Galarowicz requesting clarification of the probation term

from Atty Genda requesting correction to the JOC 
12/19/14: JOC corrected to ct. 6 dismissed.
Restitution Stipulations (2) filed.

Cases heard: 14CM128, 14CF432, 14CF412 & 14CF222, Defendant Shawn A Kemp in court, in custody with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Defendant waived preliminary hearing. Probable cause, defendant bound over.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead guilty to count 1 in 14CF222 and count 4 in 14CF412. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence in both cases: 3 yrs. prison confinement, 2 years extended supervision imposed & stayed, 6 yrs. probation with conds. Complete any alternatives to revocation now pending, restitution in the stipulation, psychological counseling/treatment and take psychotropic medications if needed. Complete anger management counseling if required by agent, maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with N.B. without agent's consent, may send mail to the house addressed to the children, maintain full-time work, school or treatment.  Pay restitution in stipulation. Pay $518 court costs in each case. DNA need not be submitted. If defendant revoked and goes to prison, 14CF412 would be consecutive to 14CF222.  In 14CF412, ct. 5 read in and dismissed, ct. 6 dismissed. In 14CF222, ct. 2 dismissed, ct. 3 read in and dismissed.  Jail credit to be determined by stipulation.  14CM128 & 14CF432 read in and dismissed.
Unsigned Restitution Stipulation for $2261.98, being $2056.35 and a surcharge of $205.63. Joint/several with case #14CF411 & 14CF413.

Defendant Shawn A Kemp in court, in custody with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Eisenberg requesting reset,  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Genda
